Course meeting times
Lectures will be held on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays from 8:30 -
9:20 am in the main lecture hall. Labs are held on Thursdays at 12:30 pm
in the computer lab. Check the syllabus for information about office
hours.

articles.title: DSCI 123
articles.description: Welcome to the homepage for DSCI 123 - Introduction to Reproducible Data Science!
articles.contents:
In this course we will learn about methods for making your data
science analyses and research reproducible! By the end of this course
you will be familiar with:
Git/GitHub
Common tidyverse packages
R Markdown for creating project reports (and possibly websites)
and more!
Here is a nice little plot using the ggplot2 package and
some artificially generated data:


library(ggplot2)

n <- 100L
b0 <- 1.0
b1 <- 2.5

set.seed(3843092)
x <- runif(n = n, min = 0, max = 1)
mu <- exp(b0 + b1 * x)
y <- rnorm(n = n, mean = mu, sd = 1.0)
dat <- data.frame(x = x, y = y)

ggplot(data = dat, aes(x = x, y = y)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth() +
  theme_light()
